TEI.2.document_title: William Anderson to Stephen F. Austin, 02-15-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Anderson to Austin, Wilkinson County, Miss., February 15, 1825.Land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1043-1044

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Anderson to Austin, Wilkinson County, Miss., February 15, 1825. Land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*Wilkenson. C°- Miss.*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-15-1825">15 Feby 1825*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin Esq.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir I avail myself of the return of *person_mentioned*Mr Huff*/person_mentioned* to your *location_mentioned*Settlement*/location_mentioned*, to acknowledge the receipt of your communication to me through him. I am extremely anxious to visit you and examine the soil of your*location_mentioned* Lands*/location_mentioned*, of which I have had the most favorable reports, and unless prevented by circumstances beyond control shall have that pleasure, in the course of the coming *date_mentioned n="spring -1815">Spring*/date_mentioned* or *date_mentioned n="Summer-1825">Summer*/date_mentioned*, I shall come prepared to secure to myself your friendly offer of Land and which you will please retain for me */p* *p**person_mentioned*WM- Anderson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
